channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Edward Caban, NYPD Commissioner, Resigns Amid Federal Investigation
item.description: Edward Caban had been asked to step down after federal agents seized his phone as part of a criminal investigation, one of several involving members o...

item.title: Alberto Fujimori, Ex-Leader of Peru Imprisoned for Rights Abuses, Dies at 86
item.description: During his decade in power, he revived the economy and crushed two violent leftist insurgencies. But he was forced out in a corruption scandal and lat...

item.title: Ken Griffin chips in to fund record-breaking $12 million contract for new US men’s soccer coach
item.description: The two year-deal is worth $6 million a year, making Pochettino the highest-paid coach in US soccer history.

item.title: Here Are the Investigations Surrounding the Administration of Eric Adams
item.description: Federal agents and prosecutors have launched an array of inquiries into Mr. Adams and some of his highest-ranking aides in City Hall.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Defends Strike on School Compound as Condemnation Mounts
item.description: The United Nations criticized the strike, which killed 18 people including six of its workers. Israel said the former school it targeted had become a ...

item.title: Amex Delta credit cards raise welcome bonus on all cards, earn up to 110,000 SkyMiles
item.description: Big changes coming to the Delta Amex suite of credit cards. Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein Faces New Indictment in New York, Prosecutors Say
item.description: The disgraced Hollywood mogul, who underwent emergency heart surgery this week, was not present in court Thursday.

item.title: U.N. Says Gaza’s Anti-Polio Campaign Is Ending With High Hopes
item.description: Health workers have reached many vulnerable children. But for the effort to be considered a success, they must also be able to administer a booster ro...

item.title: Verizon to lay off almost 5,000 employees in nearly $2 billion cost-cutting move
item.description: Over half of the employees concerned will exit in September and the rest by the end of March, according to the statement.

item.title: Why House Republicans Are Targeting China Weeks Before the Election
item.description: The G.O.P. pushed through an array of legislation to get tough on China, seeking to persuade voters that they are the party that will protect American...

item.title: Russian Forces Are Stepping Up Attacks on Pokrovsk, Ukraine Says
item.description: Bombardments are increasing in and around Pokrovsk, Ukrainian officials said, with water supplies now cut and a road overpass destroyed.

item.title: Nasdaq CEO: U.S. economic growth would be 0.5% higher if it weren’t for fraud
item.description: Nasdaq's research shows how financial crime is an invasive drag on the U.S. economy.

item.title: Russian Forces Are Stepping Up Attacks on Pokrovsk, Ukraine Says
item.description: Bombardments are increasing in and around Pokrovsk, Ukrainian officials said, with water supplies now cut and a road overpass destroyed.

item.title: Turkish-American Activist Killed in West Bank to Be Buried in Turkey
item.description: The body of Aysenur Ezgi Eygi, a Turkish American dual citizen, was being sent to Turkey for her funeral. Her fatal shooting by Israeli forces has spa...

item.title: SEC signals Ethereum is not a security in settlement with eToro
item.description: The Gensler-led agency is allowing eToro to continue trading services for Ether, along with Bitcoin and Bitcoin Cash.
